Wheelie resisted the urge to pick a fight over with Tuscon at the mention o=
f someone being injured, though the look of shooting his energon slugs from=
 his slingshot up to the somewhat bulkier Autobot's optics ran strong in hi=
s optics.

Wheelie then took a seat over to the back, "Well, if they all ge=
t to have the fun, we should go catch up and get someone! If they won't com=
e out to play, then we'll have to hit them another way.  In case they don't=
 wish to come about, we'll have to go within and out!  They're up to no goo=
d as it might ever seem, so I think we should take the chance to try and ma=
ke them scream!"


> Tucson turns to Kup. He too, could sense something a m=
iss.
> 
> " You're right Kup, something is disturbing about Windlord...  It=
 seems that perhaps some Predacon programming may have remained there resid=
ually..  Hopefully Stanton and Bump will be able to convince him to have an=
other scan done of his logic circuitry, just to be on the safe side.  No do=
ubt that Hydras has impacted us all, especially those who have been infecte=
d by that Predacon shell program."
> 
> He tightens his fist.
> 
> " That i=
s why perhaps it's wise that I confront him one on one.  He has not infecte=
d me but has struck at Rodimus, Windlord and Nightlight.  For their saftey,=
 I take the burden of dealing with Hydras personally."
> 
> Straight Shot, =
Uproar, Quickstride, and Rat Trap nearly fall out of their seats with eyes =
wide with shock. Straight Shot is the first to speak up.
> 
> "ARE YOU NUTS=
?!  YOU CAN'T DO THAT HE'LL KILL YOU!"
> 
> Quickstride chimes in next.
> 
=
> "Yeah, that's like whoah, seriously not a very good decision sir..  Very =
generous but wow, that could really be messy."
> 
> Rat Trap looks to Tucso=
n.
> 
> "Wheels, ya can't, ya just can't do that.  You got a great bunch of=
 bots, like ya said, please ya gotta accept help this time."
> 
> Tucson lo=
oks to everyone.
> 
> " I know you have all expressed concern over my actio=
ns, when it comes to Hydras, and I fully understand why you are so concerne=
d.  Hydras needs to be stopped, but I can not expect any of you to become v=
ulnerable to his attack, when it is I who should be doing something about h=
im personally.  Rodimus, I owe it to you to avenge what he has done to you,=
 Nightlight and Windlord, soley due to the fact that when you needed me yea=
rs ago, I did not come through for you.  Now, I have to redeem myself for t=
hat costly mistake, and amend the wrongs which have been set upon you."
> 
=
> Uproar looks to Tucson.
> 
> " But, that wasn't your fault.  I read up on=
 it, you didn't do anything wrong, you were out there going above and beyon=
d the call of duty and you were unexpectedly hit from behind.  There was no=
 way you could have avoided what happened to you.  Although, we don't know =
who did it do we?  That wasn't in the intel I read.  Guys, We can't let Tuc=
son face Hydras all alone, it's way too dangerous."
> 
> Straight Shot look=
s to Leo Prime and everyone else.
> 
> "Leo Prime,everyone, I believe I kno=
w how ta fill in the gaps as to what happened vorns ago.  I was with him du=
ring that battle.  He had finished dealing with some of the heavy hitting b=
attlechargers, when he noticed that Rodimus and the others were getting ser=
iously pegged out in battle.  He couldn't just sit there and watch it happe=
n, and he knew that decoy detail wasn't best suited for his alt form which =
at the time, was more designed for utility and off road driving.  But he co=
uldn't bare to see anyone suffer or be oppressed so he did the unthinkable,=
 and beyond his ability specifications, he sped out there to catch the atte=
ntions of the Seekers, who were concentrating on striking at the Autobot sp=
eedsters.  Well, Tucson got their attention and began to draw them away fro=
m Rodimus and the others, but then, un be known to him, way out in the dist=
ance, Cyclonus hid himself nicely among cloud cover, and decided to take a =
pop shot at Tucson.  Well, I saw out of the rear view, Cyclonus in the dist=
ance, and then I saw the shot coming toward us.  After that, Tucson and I w=
ere struck, but I was the only one who saw the shot and the perpetrator.  T=
hen, anything after the strike, I really don't remember."
> 
> Night Shift =
now hobbles into the room slowly.
> 
> " I do.  I - was there too.  I could=
 see Cyclonus headn' toward 'em, but I was so far off fightn' some of the c=
ombaticons, I couldn't get there fast enough ta swing Tucson or Straight Sh=
ot outa the way.  I was miles behind them  and no matter how loud I beeped =
my horn ta warn 'em, they couldn't hear me.  Then, yeah, I saw that slag ba=
ll hit my buddy, and there was an explosion that went miles up in the sky..=
 I thought for sure he was a gonner..  I did my best ta get back up, and th=
en got Tucson back ta base..  He was off line for a long time, and when he =
woke up, he thought the power went out..  Little did he know he was struck =
blind by Cyclonus, never ta see the light of day again, or at least until h=
e got a second opinion from a medic."
> 
> Straight Shot knew that Talon wo=
uld also like to see Tucson get his sight back.  She smiles to Talon and pu=
ts a hand on hers.
> 
> " I think Talon said it best, when she said it was =
time we gave Tucson back his eyes.  Leo Prime, before anything else, I thin=
k it's time you guys fought as a whole, and you really can't do that unless=
 all of you can see the road ahead of you.  So, if I may do so, I want to r=
equest that Tucson Prime undergoes a detailed examination and full repair o=
f his visual impairment."
> 
> Tucson looks to Straight Shot and Talon.
> 
=
> "They're right.  It's time I stopped procrastinating.  Stanton, Bump, I w=
ould like to give you two the honor of undergoing this proceedure.  I've se=
en your work, and I would be honored if you would perform the repairs."
> 
=
> He looks to everyone confidently.
> 
> " We will do this, we will overcom=
e every obsticle they've put in front of us.  But we must work as a team if=
 we're to achieve success." 
>
